tool.name: basinDelin

param.name: state_folder
param.dialogReference:
Select the state/region folder that contains the "archydro" and "bc_layers" folders for the region. Required if copying bc_layers, archydro or any folders within archydro to S3.

This folder should consist only of an abbreviation of one of the 50 United States (ex. NY, TX), the District of Columbia (DC), the Connecticut River Basin (CRB), the Delaware River Basin (DRB) or the Rainy River Basin (RRB).

param.name: schema_file
param.dialogReference: The input schema, in either a .gdb or .prj file.

param.name: workspaceID
param.dialogReference: Specify a location for your output watershed

param.name: pourpoint
param.dialogReference:
The json representation of the pourpoint to be used for delineation. This pourpoint should be given in WGS 84, meaning the first coordinate should be a negative number.

You can find coordinates through the StreamStats website and copy them here in (long,lat) notation. Do not add any leading zeros.

Example: [-123.456789, 44.444444]

param.name: basin_params
param.dialogReference: If checked, basin characteristics will be calculated all basin characteristics for the output basin.

param.name: parameters_list
param.dialogReference:
The semi-colon (;) separated list of characteristics to be computed. If none are given, all basin characteristics existing in the region's xml file will be calculated.

Ex. "drnarea;precip"

tool.summary:
The Basin Delineation tool processes a watershed based on the specified pour point and returns the associated watershed to the output basin file.

Basin characteristics can also be calculated for the output basin.

If you have already delineated the basin, use the "Calculate Basin Characteristics" tool, and select the delineated basin as the input basin.

dataIdInfo.idAbs:
The Basin Delineation tool processes a watershed based on the specified pour point and returns the associated watershed to the output basin file.

Basin characteristics can also be calculated for the output basin.

If you have already delineated the basin, use the "Calculate Basin Characteristics" tool, and select the delineated basin as the input basin.
